Question
========

Suppose it is given that for a given patient population, the hemoglobin (Hb) level is normally distributed with μ = 6.9 and σ = 0.7. We randomly draw one person from this population. How high should the Hb of this person be at most to belong to the lowest 20% of the population? belong?

Answerlist
----------

* 5.9523
* 6.0117
* 6.1463
* 6.3109

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 5.9523: Incorrect
* 6.0117: Incorrect
* 6.1463: Incorrect
* 6.3109: Correct
